comment: ECON 4530, not 1000. Public & Urban Econ is a tough class already, but Scafidi makes it more manageable. You are graded by 3 tests, a policy memo you must write, and attendance is graded. He gives long and thorough lectures, but anything you miss you can get from the book. His tests were tough but if you study hard and ask questions, you will pass
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Test heavy

comment: Great professor with great intentions! You must study to pass the class! A good extra credit policy will boost your grade in the end—4 tests with 6 pop quizzes. Super welcoming and would recommend!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: If I was you, I would not take this class. He springs a lot of information on you at one time. He releases practice tests before every test and they are nowhere near the same questions that are on the actual test. You are graded off of 4 tests and 7 pop quizzes which are completely random and based on attendance. Overall 3/10 professor
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Ben Scafidi was a good-ISH professor. He is EXTREMELY lecture-heavy, and doesn't really explain things the best. The class is graded by 7 pop quizzes (basically random attendance quizzes), and 4 exams with the last one being optional. I would not take this professor again because although he is funny, he teaches like you already know this stuff.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: very lecture heavy and grade is only tests and pop quizzes. you can get by going to class just for the pop quizzes but not taking notes.

comment: I had fun in Professor Scafidi's class. He always had a funny story to tell in his lectures. The grade is 3 exams and an optional final if you need it. I would encourage anyone to take his class with his straight forward teachings and funny jokes that got me laughing.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Graded on 3 tests, 6 pop quizzes, and an optional final exam. The pop quizzes are simply attendance quizzes that he gives you the answers to. He also drops 1 pop quiz. He is very knowledgeable about the subject, and kind when answering students questions. Overall, the course material isn't very hard, as long as you attend class you will be fine.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Respected

comment: Professor Scafidi was not a favorite or easy professor of mine. He gives pop quizzes to ensure everyone goes to class. He only grades on exams. comment: Most of the notes are through the online textbook, but his lectures go over the notes and he finds all sorts of fun examples to make coming to class worthwhile. comment: One of the best classes I've taken. comment: The only reason I made it through this class is his pure enthusiasm for the subject. As long as you show up to the class and work through the practice problems you'll do fine. comment: I would definitely take him for another course if he taught any. I personally enjoy economics, so I spent time going over the material to make sure I fully understood it. comment: He is the best ECON professor I've had so far. He's a very funny guy and that's one of the reasons his class is so good. He is very good at explaining the material. As long as you pay attention and do the assignments, you should be fine. Only reason I didn't get an A was because I didn't want to take the final. He made a 3h long 8 am bearable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: I'd recommend sitting in the front row of the classroom but he doesn't care if you come to class or not. There were 4 quizzes and three tests (including the final) when I took this course in fall of 2015. I did make a C in the class but if I had actually gone to class and tried I could have made an A easily. Would definitely recommend.

This class was extremely hard. Dr. Scafidi is super helpful and ended up giving some bonus points. Quizzes and tests are fairly difficult. If there is an SI Instructor for this class I would go. Only reason I passed this class was because I went for extra help. He is so nice and very understanding about the difficulty of this class.

Tests are tough and he doesn't post ANYTHING online, not even the syllabus and he doesn't pass back tests. You MUST attend class in order to do well and be prepared to teach yourself. His final is optional, but if you take it, he will bump you up if you do well. I had a 51 in the class, made an A on final and he bumped me to a C when i deserved a D

Scafidi is a great professor. If you read the book, go to class, and actually listen, you will be fine for the tests. He makes a lot of jokes which keeps the class interesting. 3 tests, optional final. Overall, a great professor for a gen ed.

Econ 2100 was definitely a hard class, but Scafidi was a great professor. Sure, he jokes a lot about "front row kids" and "back row kids", but he is extremely helpful and goes out his way to make sure that his students fully understand the concepts being introduced. 3 tests and an optional final. Read the chapter, go to class, do the homework.

Hands down worst professor I've had. He ridicules students and all semester picked on kids for sitting in the back row calling them "thugs" and "drug dealers" and insinuating kids who sit in the back of the class steal and fail assignments. I'm not paying hundreds of dollars to be bullied in class every day. DO NOT take a class with this professor.

He the best professor I have ever had. Really funny guy. He teaches in very different ways than usual professors, but really helps you understand the material on a deeper level, rather than just learning it for the exam. Study, go to class, do the practice quizzes, and go see him in his office from time to time and you will easily get an A.

NEVER AGAIN IN MY LIFE. the tests are extremely hard. there are quizzes EVERY OTHER CLASS. so don't ever think about skipping a class. Prof was just too smart. He taught class as if we were corporate economists. So if econ is ANY type of trouble for you don't take him. he teaches straight from his brain- No notes, No D2L,  No PPT, No  extra credit.

You HAVE to have the book or you'll fail. His jokes about "the back row kids" get old. I went to every class, did well on the quizzes given every Thursday. But you will not pass if you do bad on tests, which are hard. He's a good guy, but I would not recommend taking him.
